records.context_note: More than approximately 17 hours passed from the moment the migrant boat was sighted adrift for the first time (24/01/2022 at 06.54 UTC) by Frontex until it was rescued (24/01/2022 at 23.50 UTC). The Fundamental Rights Office underlines that search and rescue at sea requires prompt coordination and assistance from all parties involved to ensure the protection of migrants' right to life and to avoid, as much as possible, loss of life. While the Frontex aerial asset contributed with the detection and updates on the boat in distress which were communicated to the competent MRCC authorities, the Fundamental Rights Office underlines that a more efficient and prompt SAR response and coordination, particularly between the two MRCCs in whose search and rescue zones the boat was detected, would have been necessary, considering in particular that 7 migrants died while on board.
records.evidence_quote: A boat adrift was detected by a Frontex Surveillance Aircraft detected in the Tunisian SAR zone and later in the Maltese SAR zone with 280 + persons on board. The migrant boat was eventually rescued by the Italian authorities. During the rescue operations 7 people on board were found dead.

possible_violations.violation_name: Human dignity, right to integrity of the person, prohibition of inhuman and degrading treatment
possible_violations.legal_basis: Article 1 of the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union, Article 3 of the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union, Article 4 of the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union, Article 7 of the International Covenant on Civil and Political Rights

possible_violations.violation_name: The obligation to conduct rescue operations in accordance with international human rights standards and maritime law obligations, including disembarkation in a place of safety
possible_violations.legal_basis: SAR and SOLAS conventions

records.context_note: Considering the involvement of the third country Libya, the Fundamental Rights Office has been unable to investigate the abuse of migrants during the rescue beyond the review of video evidence from Frontex surveillance aircraft. However, based on this evidence, the Fundamental Rights Office considers that excessive force has been used by the Libyan authorities during the described incident, violating rights of persons targeted to be free from inhuman and degrading treatment. Additionally, the Fundamental Rights Office is concerned about the safety of all rescued migrants upon disembarkation, considering the reporting by international NGOs about the detention conditions in Libya. In this respect, the Fundamental Rights Office invites dialogue on better coordination of SAR activities, including Frontex' classification of vessels requiring immediate rescue.
records.evidence_quote: Frontex surveillance aircraft monitored the interception of the boat and embarkation of migrants, during which it recorded instances of physical violence by the Libyan Coast Guard vessel's crew against the people from the migrant boat. Specifically, five persons were slapped and hit to the head as well as kicked, some repeatedly. The Libyan vessel with migrants onboard then returned to Libya.

possible_violations.violation_name: The obligation to conduct rescue operations in accordance with international human rights standards and maritime law obligations

records.context_note: Based on video evidence collected by the FSA which monitored the incident, the Fundamental Rights Office considers that excessive force was used by the Libyan authorities during the described incident, violating migrants' fundamental rights including to be free from inhuman or degrading treatment. Additionally, the Fundamental Rights Office is concerned about the safety of all rescued migrants upon disembarkation in Libya. In this respect, the Fundamental Rights Office invites dialogue on better coordination of search and rescue (SAR) activities in Central Mediterranean taking into consideration that Libya cannot be considered a place of safety.
records.evidence_quote: Frontex Surveillance Aircraft recorded the Libyan Coast Guard shooting at migrants during a search and rescue operation conducted in the Libyan Search and Rescue Region (SRR) on 15/09/2021.

records.context_note: The Fundamental Rights Office finds that migrants were assisted by NGO Geo Barents 2+ hours after detection by the Frontex aerial asset. With the available information, the Fundamental Rights Office could not conclusively establish the condition of the migrants inside the boat at the time of detection or the overall duration of their journey at sea which could have led to the death of the 10 migrants on board. The Fundamental Rights Office notes that Frontex aerial asset remained on site and monitored the area of the incident and that the [redacted] acted in line with applicable legal framework and operational procedures. As regards the actions by the relevant authorities, the Fundamental Rights Office understands that Frontex team leaders did not receive a reaction or information on their cooperation/coordination of the case and underlines the importance of timely communication by all involved stakeholders. In light of the importance of such exchange and updated information, it commends the exchange between Frontex TL and IT SAR expert which allowed the FSA to proceed on site.
records.evidence_quote: On 16 November 2021 at 10:41 UTC, Heron 1 spotted a white wooden boat adrift with 100+ migrants on board inside the Libyan search and rescue zone, after having received respective information by the Italian Search and Rescue (SAR) expert on a possible overcrowded migrant boat in distress and people in the water. Three Mayday calls were broadcasted on maritime CH16 by Heron 1. Migrants were rescued by the NGO Geo Barents and disembarked in Messina port (IT). Reportedly, 10 people were found dead at the bottom of the boat.

records.uncertainty_note: The Fundamental Rights Office is aware of a migrant boat that was sighted by Frontex in the area where Alarm Phone reported the incident but was not able to assess whether the vessels are the same. Furthermore, as regards the migrant boat sighted by the Frontex Surveillance Aircraft, a revision of sighting and mission reports as well as exchange with respective Frontex Team Leaders and managers responsible for aerial surveillance made clear that the Frontex asset did not witness any Libyan intervention. For this reason, the occurrence of the incident could not be corroborated using internal data.

records.context_note: Alarm Phone alleged that the Libyan Coast Guard was shooting at migrants during a search and rescue operation in the Maltese Search and Rescue Region (SRR) on 24/11/2021. The Fundamental Rights Office is aware of a migrant boat that was sighted by Frontex in the area where Alarm Phone reported the incident but was not able to assess whether the vessels are the same. Furthermore, as regards the migrant boat sighted by the Frontex Surveillance Aircraft, a revision of sighting and mission reports as well as exchange with respective Frontex Team Leaders and managers responsible for aerial surveillance made clear that the Frontex asset did not witness any Libyan intervention. For this reason, the occurrence of the incident could not be corroborated using internal data.
records.evidence_quote: Alarm Phone alleged that the Libyan Coast Guard was shooting at migrants during a search and rescue operation in the Maltese Search and Rescue Region (SRR) on 24/11/2021.

records.uncertainty_note: The Fundamental Rights office acknowledges challenges related to the coordination of search and rescue in the location under scrutiny due to overlapping zones of state responsibilities

records.context_note: On 25/05/2022, Frontex Surveillance Aircraft team leaders (FSA TLs) diverted Heron 1 to an alleged shipwreck inside the Maltese SRR - Tunisian Territorial Waters based on information received from the Italian expert in EMT. Throughout the correspondence of the case, Maltese MRCC made clear that it had no duty to coordinate given the position inside the Tunisian Territorial Water with the Maltese Liaison Officer further insisting that a deployment of Heron 1 to the location would constitute a breach of the [redacted]. On-site, Heron 1 found the migrants in life rafts next to two NGO sailing boats but was soon asked to clear the area by Maltese Air Traffic Control (ATC) and the Maltese Armed Forces. Osprey 2 later returned to the location finding a Tunisian patrol vessel and the NGOs collaborating in rescuing the migrants eight (8) hours after Frontex had been alerted to the boat in distress and eleven (11) hours or more after Malta received a respective alert.
records.evidence_quote: Maltese MRCC made clear that it had no duty to coordinate given the position inside the Tunisian Territorial Water with the Maltese Liaison Officer further insisting that a deployment of Heron 1 to the location would constitute a breach of the [redacted].

records.context_note: The Fundamental Rights Office finds that Maltese authorities were aware of the case by 24/05/2022 1750 UTC (time of Liasion Officer request), and received the first (documented) alert on 24/05/2022 21:49 UTC providing clear information of this being a distress case ("water is entering the boat"; "Nadir cannot guarantee the safety of the people in distress "). SOS messages kept arriving with the first (documented) Mayday likely to have reached RCC Malta at 0029 UTC.
records.evidence_quote: On 12/05/2022 at 09:40 UTC, Eagle 1 spotted a blue wooden boat with 20+ migrants on board (overcrowded) adrift at [redacted] (reference: FSA [redacted]).
